intro: Villarsia calthifolia, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
